network
Interface OperatingSystem

public interface OperatingSystem

The API by which a Process can perform system operations such as send(Message) and receive(int).

Author:
Luke Maurer
See Also:
Process, UserKernel

Nested Class Summary
static class OperatingSystem.DisconnectedException
          Exception indicating that an send(Message) call was made when the node is not connected to any other.

Method Detail

logger

Logger logger()
Get a logger to use for output.

Returns:
A JDK Logger object, preconfigured for this node.

address

int address()
returns the address of the kernel it's on...

Returns:
the address of the node we are on

send

void send(Message<?> message)
          throws OperatingSystem.DisconnectedException,
                 InterruptedException
Send a message to another node, according to its Message.destination field. Blocks until the message leaves the interface.

Parameters:
message - The message to send.
Throws:
InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.
OperatingSystem.DisconnectedException

send

void send(int dest,
          int sourcePort,
          int destPort,
          Serializable content)
          throws OperatingSystem.DisconnectedException,
                 InterruptedException
Send a message to another node. Blocks until the message leaves the interface.

This method is equivalent to calling send(Message) with a newly constructed Message object.

Parameters:
dest - The node to which to send the message.
sourcePort - The port from which the message is said to originate.
destPort - The port to which to send the message.
content - The content of the message.
Throws:
InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.
OperatingSystem.DisconnectedException

send

void send(int dest,
          KnownPort sourcePort,
          KnownPort destPort,
          Serializable content)
          throws OperatingSystem.DisconnectedException,
                 InterruptedException
Send a message to another node. Blocks until the message leaves the interface.

This method is equivalent to calling send(Message) with a newly constructed Message object.

Parameters:
dest - The node to which to send the message.
sourcePort - The port from which the message is said to originate.
destPort - The port to which to send the message.
content - The content of the message.
Throws:
InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.
OperatingSystem.DisconnectedException

receive

Message<?> receive(int port)
                   throws InterruptedException
Receive the next message sent to the given port on this node. Blocks until the message is received.

Parameters:
port - The port to listen on.
Returns:
The next message this node receives.
Throws:
InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.

receive

                   throws InterruptedException
Receive the next message sent to the given port on this node. Blocks until the message is received.

Parameters:
port - The port to listen on.
Returns:
The next message this node receives.
Throws:
InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.

receive

Message<?> receive(int port,
                   long timeout,
                   TimeUnit unit)
                   throws InterruptedException
Receive the next message sent to the given port on this node. Blocks until the message is received or timeout occurs.

Parameters:
port - The port to listen on.
timeout - How long to wait before timing out.
unit - The unit for timeout.
Returns:
The next message this node receives, or null if timeout occurs before then.
Throws:
InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.

receive

Message<?> receive(KnownPort port,
                   long timeout,
                   TimeUnit unit)
                   throws InterruptedException
Receive the next message sent to the given port on this node. Blocks until the message is received or timeout occurs.

Parameters:
port - The port to listen on.
timeout - How long to wait before timing out.
unit - The unit for timeout.
Returns:
The next message this node receives, or null if timeout occurs before then.
Throws:
InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.

replaceProcess

void replaceProcess(Process process)
                    throws InterruptedException
Halt the running process, replacing it with the given one.

Parameters:
process - The process to run in place of the current one.
Throws:
InterruptedException - Always.

fork

void fork(Runnable runnable)
Spawn a new thread. This should be used instead of built-in Java thread creation mechanisms so that the threads can be kept track of.

Parameters:
runnable - The Runnable to run in the new thread.
